comment.body: I could help with German
German Translation: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/pull/653
German: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/zeronet.io/pull/6
I was bored enough to scroll down until I found this post. Therefor i comment here. :D

@Wonderingdane: I'm planing to do just that. I'm working on my own version of ZeroMe http://localhost:43110/me.mkg20001.bit that will be merged with ZeroNet (see https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/pull/74 )
@Mynameislegion: http://localhost:43110/1LBr1dHoXvJAMjDgW8Wcg5kbCoKyJnzo6p/ and http://localhost:43110/zerotorrent.bit/

@Jayofthezero: Remember what happend to the MORPHiS guy? https://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/5m18v0/sam_maloney_creator_of_morphis_and_dpush_has_been/ and https://motherboard.vice.com/en_us/article/why-did-police-kill-an-alleged-small-time-hacker-canada-sam-maloney

@cyberslave: And they think only because they partly can break tor that they can break anything. And if they can't they just blame encryption. Working encryption = Bad for the goverment = good for everybody else :P
@Styromaniac: Maybe the same is true for TED as it is for /r/anarchism . Just a bunch of fascists. (maybe I am also wrong and they _just_ made a mistake)
@ZAlex: It's the cryptowar. The "old" war has ended, the "new" war starts. It won't take long until a global "Great Firewall" appears.
@Lmath: I don't know if that is a good idea. When that picture contains NSFW content or other stuff you don't want to see?
@Jayofthezero: Infinite amount of Rainbow Hubs :D
@Yuzu: Ok. That's an idea. I will add it as soon as I start working on the new settings page.
@Ranxerox: You download them. Then they (all the data.json files) get merged into one sql database locally that you query from.

@P2P: Yes, but using pip isn't actually that hard. It's just a .txt file with a list of dependencies.
On the other hand: All the other issues he mentioned are not that obvious.
@P2P: Why not bundle the stuff pip downloads into the bundle / update server?
@P2P: The users would have to run pip themselves, but we could pack all the stuff pip downloads with the updates. So it isn't stored in git anymore but still distributed with zeronet.
@P2P: I don't know. The only difference would be that the lib folder does not exist anymore
Pure madness.
@Yinyue: You're right GFW is way worse than Russia's censorship. But it's still important to know whether (more like when) Russia will have the next GFW.
Horrible

> This implies the only available way to do personal computing today, is to destroy your expensive laptop and run ZeroNet on your GBA.

:D
@Jayofthezero: It's humanity. Except of some few people, most humans are dumb. Because how else would have so many people voted for trump?
